Hi everyone,

I've been playing with JUnit for a little while now and there is one 
feature in the Swing GUI that kinda disapeared from 3.2 to 3.7; the 
ability to run one TestSuite individually from the Test Hierarchy. If 
you select a TestSuite (or, actually, anything that is not a TestCase 
subclass) the Run button is disabled.

The reason behind that -- I think -- is that for every test to be 
atomic, it need to be reloaded before running. It's easy to reload a 
TestCase subclass. It would be harder to reload a TestSuite or an 
object implementing the Test interface.

What I'm proposing is to implement a "junit.framework.Reloadable" 
interface to allow tests that aren't subclasses of the "TestCase" 
class to be reloaded and rerun from the Swing GUI. That interface 
would only have one method:

public Test reload();

Or maybe the java.lang.Cloneable interface could be used.

Anyway, I will implement those changes locally because it's a feature 
I really need. If you think it could be a good thing to include in 
JUnit, let me know and I'll send you the source code.


Alexandre
